content: little miss two designed by sharon maher laughing purple goldfish designs copyright 2008 gorgeous simple handbag measures 12cm x 12cm… quick and easy project yarns required - whatever you have on hand it doesn t take much - i have used blue pink and white reclaimed cotton also - 3 0 mm crochet hook - wool needle - button to embellish the flower - small amount of lining fabric let s begin using blue cotton chain 21 round 1 single_crochet into 2nd chain from hook and every chain after that until you reach the end 20 then turn work upside down and single_crochet into the other side of all those chains until you reach the beginning again 40 slip_stitch join to starting chain round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in every stitch to end 40 continue working in rounds of single_crochet until work measures 9cm 16 rounds eyelet round ch3 skip 1 double_crochet chain skip 1 … repeat underlined section to end of round work 3 more rounds of single_crochet as before change colour to pink for trim work one round of single_crochet strap using pink cotton chain 4 round 1 single_crochet into 2nd chain from hook single_crochet to end 3 turn round 2 ch1 single_crochet into next 3 stitches turn repeat round 2 until strap measures 27cm attach to bag final edging using pink cotton and starting at the end of the strap work a row of single_crochet along one edge when you reach the end of the strap work a picot edge along the top of the bag until you are back where you started then repeat for the other side picot edge instructions single_crochet in first stitch then single_crochet double_crochet single_crochet in next stitch repeat underlined section to end thread pink strands of yarn through the eyelets or maybe ribbon flower using white cotton make an adjustable loop chain double_crochet 2trb double_crochet 2sc … repeat underline section 4 times in total… double_crochet 2trb double_crochet single_crochet… tighten loop… slip_stitch to first chain… fasten_off you should have created a flower with five petals using pink cotton work in single_crochet around the outside of the flower at the end of each petal single_crochet right into the centre hole as illustrated… dividing the petals attach flower to bag and add button line if desired
